intro: Amphilophium nunezii, commonly known as the Núñez's amphilophium, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant prefers cool, humid environments and is often found in moist, shaded forest understories. Its leaves are typically broad and have a smooth texture, while its flowers display a range of colors from white to pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Amphilophium nunezii is considered a species of conservation concern.
